sys_update_xml.payload:
The catalog item has the proper logic

]]>truefalsenot requested8d05076f1ba1330010b2db15cc4bcb8dproductfalse0automatic0Feature0falseThe catalog item needs to generate a user id every time the First Name or the Last Name changes, and as the created users will eventually sync up to the customer's active directory, the guidelines and restrictions to create a new user are the following: Last Name + Initial of the First Name (the initial of the first name should always be at the end), with a limit of 8 Characters, the script should look for existing user ids that match the generated one, and if that is the case, it should add a number at the end, examples: First + Last -> UserId Peter Parker -> ParkerP Natasha Romanoff -> RomanofN Bruce Wayne -> WayneB Clark Kent -> KentC a 2nd Clark Kent -> KentC1 a 3rd Clark Kent -> KentC21970-01-02 00:00:002019-08-16 17:16:1904000100000false3falsefalsetruefalseSTRY00100082019-08-16 17:16:196816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be4410false049a844fab1ba1330010b2db15cc4bcb402000000falsetrue2019-08-16 17:16:192019-08-16 17:16:19falseNew Servicenow User Creation Catalog Item (part 2)-12019-08-16 17:16:191greenrm_storyadmin2019-08-16 18:19:58global/139368f9db13330011b3e9c9489619916admin2021-03-12 02:22:18New Servicenow User Creation Catalog Item (part 2)​STRY0010008STRY001000843ac50d42f223300c3933c96f699b620asap139368f9db13330011b3e9c948961991proceedcancel30

As a product owner:

  • I need to know if i should use the update source module or the retrieve update set module to move update sets.
  • I need to have all the development for sprint 1 in prod


]]>truefalsenot requested0aa9e8a52f223300c3933c96f699b6e48d05076f1ba1330010b2db15cc4bcb8dproductfalse0automatic0Feature2019-05-28 15:56:486816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be4410falseTo apply changes on the Test/Prod instance, an update source will be created: - on the test instance - pointing to the dev instance - using the following user (it needs to be created with admin role) + user: "update.retriever" | pwd: "serbisnau" Commit the update sets for sprint 1 to production.1970-01-02 00:00:002019-05-27 17:01:5204009800000false3falsefalsetruefalseSTRY00100342019-05-27 17:01:526816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be4410false4e905f671be1330010b2db15cc4bcbd104ba6447ab1ba1330010b2db15cc4bcbb012000000falsetrue2019-05-27 17:01:522019-05-27 17:01:52falseConfigure "Update Source" and move update set from dev to prod4e905f671be1330010b2db15cc4bcbd13000002019-05-27 17:01:521green1rm_storyadmin2019-05-27 17:06:37global/f58793ef1be1330010b2db15cc4bcbf124admin2021-03-12 02:57:21Configure "Update Source" and move update set from dev to prod​STRY0010034STRY0010034e7cc98942f223300c3933c96f699b66easapf58793ef1be1330010b2db15cc4bcbf1proceedcancel301970-01-02 22:15:35

sys_update_xml.name: sys_script_include_59a42c121b31330010b2db15cc4bcbb9
sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="sys_script_include"><sys_script_include action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><access>package_private</access><active>true</active><api_name>global.updateSetUtils</api_name><caller_access/><client_callable>false</client_callable><description/><name>updateSetUtils</name><script><![CDATA[var updateSetUtils = Class.create();
updateSetUtils.prototype = {
    initialize: function (limit) {
        this.limit = (limit <= 2500)? limit : 2500;
        this.instance = gs.getProperty('instance_name');
    },

	test: function(recordGr){
        this.createUpdateSetAndSetAsCurrent();
        this.pushToCurrentUpdateSet(recordGr);
    },

    generateTableSetsInOneSet: function(tableList,updateName){
        this.createUpdateSetAndSetAsCurrent(updateName);
		for(var id in tableList){    
            var tableName = tableList[id]["name"];
            var updateCounter = 0;
            var recordCount = 0;
            var tableGr = new GlideRecord(tableName);
			var query = (tableList[id]["query"])? tableList[id]["query"]:'';
			tableGr.addEncodedQuery(query);
            tableGr.query();
            while(tableGr.next()){
                this.pushToCurrentUpdateSet(tableGr);
                recordCount++;
                if(recordCount>this.limit){
                    recordCount = 0;
                    updateCounter++;
                    updateName = updateName+"-"+updateCounter;
					this.createUpdateSetAndSetAsCurrent(updateName);
                }
            }
        }
    },
	
	generateTableSets: function(tableList){
        for(var name in tableList){    
            var tableName = tableList[name];
            
            var updateCounter = 0;
            var updateName = tableName+"-"+updateCounter;
            this.createUpdateSetAndSetAsCurrent(updateName);
            
            var recordCount = 0;
            var tableGr = new GlideRecord(tableName);
            tableGr.query();
            while(tableGr.next()){
                this.pushToCurrentUpdateSet(tableGr);
                recordCount++;
                if(recordCount>this.limit){
                    recordCount = 0;
                    updateCounter++;
                    updateName = tableName+"-"+updateCounter;
                    this.createUpdateSetAndSetAsCurrent(updateName);
                }
            }
        }
    },
    
    getAllModifiedTables: function () {
        var tableList = [];
        var query = "sys_created_on>=javascript:gs.dateGenerate('2018-09-28','00:00:00')";
        var gr = new GlideRecord('sys_dictionary');
        gr.addEncodedQuery('internal_type.label=Collection');
        gr.query();
        while (gr.next()) {
            var currTable = gr.getValue('name');
            if (!this.isTrackedInUpdateSets(currTable) && this.isSuperClass(currTable)) {
                try {
                    var gr1 = new GlideAggregate(currTable);
                    gr1.addAggregate('COUNT');
                    gr1.addEncodedQuery(query);
                    gr1.query();
                    if (gr1.next()) {
                        var count = parseInt(gr1.getAggregate('COUNT'));
                        if (count > 0){
                            tableList.push(currTable);
							//this.logger('Table: ' + currTable + ' has: ' + count + ' records');
							}
                    }
                } catch (err) {
                    //this.logger("We've got an error for table: " + gr.name.toString(),"getAllModifiedTables");
                    continue;
                }
            }
        }
    },

    isTrackedInUpdateSets: function (tableName) {
        var dbOb = new GlideRecord('sys_db_object');
        dbOb.addQuery('name', tableName);
        //if it extends application file, its tracked in update sets
        dbOb.addQuery('super_class', '=', '3f393202db3023005c5d8a503996195c');
        dbOb.query();
        return dbOb.hasNext();
    },

    isSuperClass: function(tableName){
        var dbOb = new GlideRecord('sys_db_object');
        dbOb.addEncodedQuery('name='+tableName+'^super_classISEMPTY');
        dbOb.query();
        return dbOb.hasNext();
    },

    createUpdateSetAndSetAsCurrent: function(updateName){
        var createdSetId = this.createUpdateSet(updateName);
        this.setUpdateAsCurrent(createdSetId);
    },
    
    createUpdateSet: function(name){
        var setName = (name)? name: "generic v1.0";
        var setGr = new GlideRecord('sys_update_set');
        setGr.initialize();
        setGr.setValue('name',setName);
        setGr.setValue('state','in progress');
        return setGr.insert();
    },

    setUpdateAsCurrent: function(setId){
        var us = new GlideUpdateSet();
	    us.set(setId);
    },

    pushToCurrentUpdateSet: function(record){
        var um = new GlideUpdateManager2();
        um.saveRecord(record);
    },

    logger: function (msg, source) {
        gs.log(msg, source);
    },

    type: 'updateSetUtils'
};]]></script><sys_class_name>sys_script_include</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2019-06-04 17:03:48</sys_created_on><sys_id>59a42c121b31330010b2db15cc4bcbb9</sys_id><sys_mod_count>27</sys_mod_count><sys_name>updateSetUtils</sys_name><sys_package display_value="Global" source="global">global</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value="Global">global</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sys_script_include_59a42c121b31330010b2db15cc4bcbb9</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2019-07-08 22:16:09</sys_updated_on></sys_script_include></record_update>

sys_update_xml.payload:

]]>true0falsenot requested8d05076f1ba1330010b2db15cc4bcb8dproduct0false0automatic0Feature0falseThe catalog item needs to generate a user id every time the First Name or the Last Name changes, and as the created users will eventually sync up to the customer's active directory, the guidelines and restrictions to create a new user are the following: Last Name + Initial of the First Name (the initial of the first name should always be at the end), with a limit of 8 Characters, the script should look for existing user ids that match the generated one, and if that is the case, it should add a number at the end, examples: First + Last -> UserId Peter Parker -> ParkerP Natasha Romanoff -> RomanofN Bruce Wayne -> WayneB Clark Kent -> KentC a 2nd Clark Kent -> KentC1 a 3rd Clark Kent -> KentC21970-01-02 00:00:002019-08-16 17:16:19040001000003falsefalsetruefalseSTRY00100082019-08-16 17:16:196816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be44104e905f671be1330010b2db15cc4bcbd10waterfall49a844fab1ba1330010b2db15cc4bcb40200000000false2019-08-16 17:16:192019-08-16 17:16:19falseNew Servicenow User Creation Catalog Item (part 2)4e905f671be1330010b2db15cc4bcbd116000002019-08-16 17:16:191greenrm_storyadmin2019-08-16 18:19:58global/139368f9db13330011b3e9c9489619913admin2019-08-16 20:43:31New Servicenow User Creation Catalog Item (part 2)​STRY001000843ac50d42f223300c3933c96f699b620falseasap139368f9db13330011b3e9c948961991proceedcancel30

If work notes are added to a parent incident, they get copied to the incident tasks

]]>truefalsenot requested8d05076f1ba1330010b2db15cc4bcb8dproductfalse0automatic0Feature0falseEvery time a work note is added to an Incident, it need to be copied to all child Incident Tasks on active state with the format: "[Added from <Number>]\n<Work note>" Every time a work note is added to an Incident Task, it need to be copied to the parent Incident (on the "Incident" field) with the format: "[Added from <Number>]\n<Work note>" it must not loop and only comments from an interactive session should be added1970-01-02 00:00:002019-05-28 15:55:2004010900000false3falsefalsetruefalseSTRY00100852019-05-28 15:55:206816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be4410false0405744fab1ba1330010b2db15cc4bcbb98000000falsetrue2019-05-28 15:55:202019-05-28 15:55:20falseSync work notes between Incident and Incident Task-12019-05-28 15:55:20-6greenrm_storyadmin2019-05-28 16:01:26global/f8e110c81bb9330010b2db15cc4bcb7e12admin2021-03-12 02:22:18Sync work notes between Incident and Incident Task​STRY0010085STRY0010085e7cc98942f223300c3933c96f699b66easapf8e110c81bb9330010b2db15cc4bcb7eproceedcancel30
